image.title: image
image.description: The container image used in the API server manifest.

extraArgs.title: extraArgs
extraArgs.description: Extra arguments to supply to the API server.

extraVolumes.title: extraVolumes
extraVolumes.description: Extra volumes to mount to the API server static pod.

env.title: env
env.description: The `env` field allows for the addition of environment variables for the control plane component.

certSANs.title: certSANs
certSANs.description: Extra certificate subject alternative names for the API server's certificate.

disablePodSecurityPolicy.title: disablePodSecurityPolicy
disablePodSecurityPolicy.description: Disable PodSecurityPolicy in the API server and default manifests.

admissionControl.title: admissionControl
admissionControl.description: Configure the API server admission plugins.

auditPolicy.title: auditPolicy
auditPolicy.description: Configure the API server audit policy.

certLifetime.title: certLifetime
certLifetime.description:
Admin kubeconfig certificate lifetime (default is 1 year).
Field format accepts any Go time.Duration format ('1h' for one hour, '10m' for ten minutes).

name.title: name
name.description:
Name is the name of the admission controller.
It must match the registered admission plugin name.

configuration.title: configuration
configuration.description:
Configuration is an embedded configuration object to be used as the plugin's
configuration.

interfaces.title: interfaces
interfaces.description: The interfaces that make up the bond.

arpIPTarget.title: arpIPTarget
arpIPTarget.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.
Not supported at the moment.

mode.title: mode
mode.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

xmitHashPolicy.title: xmitHashPolicy
xmitHashPolicy.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

lacpRate.title: lacpRate
lacpRate.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

adActorSystem.title: adActorSystem
adActorSystem.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.
Not supported at the moment.

arpValidate.title: arpValidate
arpValidate.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

arpAllTargets.title: arpAllTargets
arpAllTargets.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

primary.title: primary
primary.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

primaryReselect.title: primaryReselect
primaryReselect.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

failOverMac.title: failOverMac
failOverMac.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

adSelect.title: adSelect
adSelect.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

miimon.title: miimon
miimon.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

updelay.title: updelay
updelay.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

downdelay.title: downdelay
downdelay.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

arpInterval.title: arpInterval
arpInterval.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

resendIgmp.title: resendIgmp
resendIgmp.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

minLinks.title: minLinks
minLinks.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

lpInterval.title: lpInterval
lpInterval.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

packetsPerSlave.title: packetsPerSlave
packetsPerSlave.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

numPeerNotif.title: numPeerNotif
numPeerNotif.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

tlbDynamicLb.title: tlbDynamicLb
tlbDynamicLb.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

allSlavesActive.title: allSlavesActive
allSlavesActive.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

useCarrier.title: useCarrier
useCarrier.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

adActorSysPrio.title: adActorSysPrio
adActorSysPrio.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

adUserPortKey.title: adUserPortKey
adUserPortKey.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

peerNotifyDelay.title: peerNotifyDelay
peerNotifyDelay.description:
A bond option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

interfaces.title: interfaces
interfaces.description: The interfaces that make up the bridge.

stp.title: stp
stp.description:
A bridge option.
Please see the official kernel documentation.

urls.title: urls
urls.description:
URLs containing manifests to apply for the CNI.
Should be present for "custom", must be empty for "flannel" and "none".

id.title: id
id.description: Globally unique identifier for this cluster (base64 encoded random 32 bytes).

secret.title: secret
secret.description:
Shared secret of cluster (base64 encoded random 32 bytes).
This secret is shared among cluster members but should never be sent over the network.

controlPlane.title: controlPlane
controlPlane.description: Provides control plane specific configuration options.

network.title: network
network.description: Provides cluster specific network configuration options.

token.title: token
token.description: The [bootstrap token](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/bootstrap-tokens/) used to join the cluster.

aescbcEncryptionSecret.title: aescbcEncryptionSecret
aescbcEncryptionSecret.description:
description: |
    A key used for the [encryption of secret data at rest](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/encrypt-data/).
  examples:
    - name: Decryption secret example (do not use in production!).
    Enables encryption with AESCBC.
      value: '"z01mye6j16bspJYtTB/5SFX8j7Ph4JXxM2Xuu4vsBPM="'

secretboxEncryptionSecret.title: secretboxEncryptionSecret
secretboxEncryptionSecret.description:
A key used for the [encryption of secret data at rest](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/encrypt-data/).
Enables encryption with secretbox.
Secretbox has precedence over AESCBC.

ca.title: ca
ca.description: The base64 encoded root certificate authority used by Kubernetes.

aggregatorCA.title: aggregatorCA
aggregatorCA.description:
The base64 encoded aggregator certificate authority used by Kubernetes for front-proxy certificate generation.

This CA can be self-signed.

serviceAccount.title: serviceAccount
serviceAccount.description: The base64 encoded private key for service account token generation.

controllerManager.title: controllerManager
controllerManager.description: Controller manager server specific configuration options.

extraManifests.title: extraManifests
extraManifests.description:
A list of urls that point to additional manifests.
These will get automatically deployed as part of the bootstrap.

extraManifestHeaders.title: extraManifestHeaders
extraManifestHeaders.description: A map of key value pairs that will be added while fetching the extraManifests.

inlineManifests.title: inlineManifests
inlineManifests.description:
A list of inline Kubernetes manifests.
These will get automatically deployed as part of the bootstrap.

adminKubeconfig.title: adminKubeconfig
adminKubeconfig.description:
Settings for admin kubeconfig generation.
Certificate lifetime can be configured.

allowSchedulingOnControlPlanes.title: allowSchedulingOnControlPlanes
allowSchedulingOnControlPlanes.description: Allows running workload on control-plane nodes.

enabled.title: enabled
enabled.description:
Enable the cluster membership discovery feature.
Cluster discovery is based on individual registries which are configured under the registries field.

registries.title: registries
registries.description: Configure registries used for cluster member discovery.

name.title: name
name.description:
Name of the manifest.
Name should be unique.

cni.title: cni
cni.description:
The CNI used.
Composed of "name" and "urls".
The "name" key supports the following options: "flannel", "custom", and "none".
"flannel" uses Talos-managed Flannel CNI, and that's the default option.
"custom" uses custom manifests that should be provided in "urls".
"none" indicates that Talos will not manage any CNI installation.

dnsDomain.title: dnsDomain
dnsDomain.description:
The domain used by Kubernetes DNS.
The default is `cluster.local`

version.title: version
version.description: Indicates the schema used to decode the contents.

debug.title: debug
debug.description:
Enable verbose logging to the console.
All system containers logs will flow into serial console.

**Note:** To avoid breaking Talos bootstrap flow enable this option only if serial console can handle high message throughput.

persist.title: persist
persist.description: Indicates whether to pull the machine config upon every boot.

endpoint.title: endpoint
endpoint.description:
Endpoint is the canonical controlplane endpoint, which can be an IP address or a DNS hostname.
It is single-valued, and may optionally include a port number.

localAPIServerPort.title: localAPIServerPort
localAPIServerPort.description:
The port that the API server listens on internally.
This may be different than the port portion listed in the endpoint field above.
The default is `6443`.

image.title: image
image.description: The container image used in the controller manager manifest.

extraArgs.title: extraArgs
extraArgs.description: Extra arguments to supply to the controller manager.

extraVolumes.title: extraVolumes
extraVolumes.description: Extra volumes to mount to the controller manager static pod.

env.title: env
env.description: The `env` field allows for the addition of environment variables for the control plane component.

disabled.title: disabled
disabled.description: Disable coredns deployment on cluster bootstrap.

image.title: image
image.description: The `image` field is an override to the default coredns image.

routeMetric.title: routeMetric
routeMetric.description: The priority of all routes received via DHCP.

ipv4.title: ipv4
ipv4.description: Enables DHCPv4 protocol for the interface (default is enabled).

ipv6.title: ipv6
ipv6.description: Enables DHCPv6 protocol for the interface (default is disabled).

interface.title: interface
interface.description:
The interface name.
Mutually exclusive with `deviceSelector`.

deviceSelector.title: deviceSelector
deviceSelector.description:
Picks a network device using the selector.
Mutually exclusive with `interface`.
Supports partial match using wildcard syntax.

addresses.title: addresses
addresses.description:
Assigns static IP addresses to the interface.
An address can be specified either in proper CIDR notation or as a standalone address (netmask of all ones is assumed).

routes.title: routes
routes.description:
A list of routes associated with the interface.
If used in combination with DHCP, these routes will be appended to routes returned by DHCP server.

mtu.title: mtu
mtu.description:
The interface's MTU.
If used in combination with DHCP, this will override any MTU settings returned from DHCP server.

dhcp.title: dhcp
dhcp.description:
Indicates if DHCP should be used to configure the interface.
The following DHCP options are supported:

- `OptionClasslessStaticRoute`
- `OptionDomainNameServer`
- `OptionDNSDomainSearchList`
- `OptionHostName`

ignore.title: ignore
ignore.description: Indicates if the interface should be ignored (skips configuration).

dummy.title: dummy
dummy.description:
Indicates if the interface is a dummy interface.
`dummy` is used to specify that this interface should be a virtual-only, dummy interface.

dhcpOptions.title: dhcpOptions
dhcpOptions.description:
DHCP specific options.
`dhcp` *must* be set to true for these to take effect.

wireguard.title: wireguard
wireguard.description:
Wireguard specific configuration.
Includes things like private key, listen port, peers.

ip.title: ip
ip.description: Specifies the IP address to be used.

equinixMetal.title: equinixMetal
equinixMetal.description: Specifies the Equinix Metal API settings to assign VIP to the node.

hcloud.title: hcloud
hcloud.description: Specifies the Hetzner Cloud API settings to assign VIP to the node.

privateKey.title: privateKey
privateKey.description:
Specifies a private key configuration (base64 encoded).
Can be generated by `wg genkey`.

peers.title: peers
peers.description: Specifies a list of peer configurations to apply to a device.

publicKey.title: publicKey
publicKey.description:
Specifies the public key of this peer.
Can be extracted from private key by running `wg pubkey < private.key > public.key && cat public.key`.

endpoint.title: endpoint
endpoint.description: Specifies the endpoint of this peer entry.

persistentKeepaliveInterval.title: persistentKeepaliveInterval
persistentKeepaliveInterval.description:
Specifies the persistent keepalive interval for this peer.
Field format accepts any Go time.Duration format ('1h' for one hour, '10m' for ten minutes).

allowedIPs.title: allowedIPs
allowedIPs.description: AllowedIPs specifies a list of allowed IP addresses in CIDR notation for this peer.

kubernetes.title: kubernetes
kubernetes.description:
Kubernetes registry uses Kubernetes API server to discover cluster members and stores additional information
as annotations on the Node resources.

service.title: service
service.description: Service registry is using an external service to push and pull information about cluster members.

size.title: size
size.description: The size of partition: either bytes or human readable representation. If `size:` is omitted, the partition is sized to occupy the full disk.

provider.title: provider
provider.description: Encryption provider to use for the encryption.

keys.title: keys
keys.description: Defines the encryption keys generation and storage method.

cipher.title: cipher
cipher.description: Cipher kind to use for the encryption. Depends on the encryption provider.

options.title: options
options.description: Additional --perf parameters for the LUKS2 encryption.

static.title: static
static.description: Key which value is stored in the configuration file.

nodeID.title: nodeID
nodeID.description: Deterministically generated key from the node UUID and PartitionLabel.

slot.title: slot
slot.description: Key slot number for LUKS2 encryption.

image.title: image
image.description: The container image used to create the etcd service.

ca.title: ca
ca.description:
The `ca` is the root certificate authority of the PKI.
It is composed of a base64 encoded `crt` and `key`.

extraArgs.title: extraArgs
extraArgs.description:
Extra arguments to supply to etcd.
Note that the following args are not allowed:

- `name`
- `data-dir`
- `initial-cluster-state`
- `listen-peer-urls`
- `listen-client-urls`
- `cert-file`
- `key-file`
- `trusted-ca-file`
- `peer-client-cert-auth`
- `peer-cert-file`
- `peer-trusted-ca-file`
- `peer-key-file`

advertisedSubnets.title: advertisedSubnets
advertisedSubnets.description:
The `advertisedSubnets` field configures the networks to pick etcd advertised IP from.

IPs can be excluded from the list by using negative match with `!`, e.g `!10.0.0.0/8`.
Negative subnet matches should be specified last to filter out IPs picked by positive matches.
If not specified, advertised IP is selected as the first routable address of the node.

listenSubnets.title: listenSubnets
listenSubnets.description:
The `listenSubnets` field configures the networks for the etcd to listen for peer and client connections.

If `listenSubnets` is not set, but `advertisedSubnets` is set, `listenSubnets` defaults to
`advertisedSubnets`.

If neither `advertisedSubnets` nor `listenSubnets` is set, `listenSubnets` defaults to listen on all addresses.

IPs can be excluded from the list by using negative match with `!`, e.g `!10.0.0.0/8`.
Negative subnet matches should be specified last to filter out IPs picked by positive matches.
If not specified, advertised IP is selected as the first routable address of the node.

manifests.title: manifests
manifests.description:
A list of urls that point to additional manifests for an external cloud provider.
These will get automatically deployed as part of the bootstrap.

kubernetesTalosAPIAccess.title: kubernetesTalosAPIAccess
kubernetesTalosAPIAccess.description:
Configure Talos API access from Kubernetes pods.

This feature is disabled if the feature config is not specified.

apidCheckExtKeyUsage.title: apidCheckExtKeyUsage
apidCheckExtKeyUsage.description: Enable checks for extended key usage of client certificates in apid.

diskSelector.title: diskSelector
diskSelector.description:
Look up disk using disk attributes like model, size, serial and others.
Always has priority over `disk`.

extraKernelArgs.title: extraKernelArgs
extraKernelArgs.description: Allows for supplying extra kernel args via the bootloader.

image.title: image
image.description:
Allows for supplying the image used to perform the installation.
Image reference for each Talos release can be found on
[GitHub releases page](https://github.com/siderolabs/talos/releases).

extensions.title: extensions
extensions.description: Allows for supplying additional system extension images to install on top of base Talos image.

bootloader.title: bootloader
bootloader.description: Indicates if a bootloader should be installed.

wipe.title: wipe
wipe.description:
Indicates if the installation disk should be wiped at installation time.
Defaults to `true`.

legacyBIOSSupport.title: legacyBIOSSupport
legacyBIOSSupport.description:
Indicates if MBR partition should be marked as bootable (active).
Should be enabled only for the systems with legacy BIOS that doesn't support GPT partitioning scheme.

parameters.title: parameters
parameters.description: Module parameters, changes applied after reboot.

endpoints.title: endpoints
endpoints.description:
Filter node addresses which will be advertised as KubeSpan endpoints for peer-to-peer Wireguard connections.

By default, all addresses are advertised, and KubeSpan cycles through all endpoints until it finds one that works.

Default value: no filtering.

image.title: image
image.description: The `image` field is an optional reference to an alternative kubelet image.

clusterDNS.title: clusterDNS
clusterDNS.description: The `ClusterDNS` field is an optional reference to an alternative kubelet clusterDNS ip list.

extraArgs.title: extraArgs
extraArgs.description: The `extraArgs` field is used to provide additional flags to the kubelet.

extraMounts.title: extraMounts
extraMounts.description:
The `extraMounts` field is used to add additional mounts to the kubelet container.
Note that either `bind` or `rbind` are required in the `options`.

extraConfig.title: extraConfig
extraConfig.description:
The `extraConfig` field is used to provide kubelet configuration overrides.

Some fields are not allowed to be overridden: authentication and authorization, cgroups
configuration, ports, etc.

defaultRuntimeSeccompProfileEnabled.title: defaultRuntimeSeccompProfileEnabled
defaultRuntimeSeccompProfileEnabled.description: Enable container runtime default Seccomp profile.

registerWithFQDN.title: registerWithFQDN
registerWithFQDN.description:
The `registerWithFQDN` field is used to force kubelet to use the node FQDN for registration.
This is required in clouds like AWS.

nodeIP.title: nodeIP
nodeIP.description:
The `nodeIP` field is used to configure `--node-ip` flag for the kubelet.
This is used when a node has multiple addresses to choose from.

skipNodeRegistration.title: skipNodeRegistration
skipNodeRegistration.description:
The `skipNodeRegistration` is used to run the kubelet without registering with the apiserver.
This runs kubelet as standalone and only runs static pods.

disableManifestsDirectory.title: disableManifestsDirectory
disableManifestsDirectory.description:
The `disableManifestsDirectory` field configures the kubelet to get static pod manifests from the /etc/kubernetes/manifests directory.
It's recommended to configure static pods with the "pods" key instead.

validSubnets.title: validSubnets
validSubnets.description:
The `validSubnets` field configures the networks to pick kubelet node IP from.
For dual stack configuration, there should be two subnets: one for IPv4, another for IPv6.
IPs can be excluded from the list by using negative match with `!`, e.g `!10.0.0.0/8`.
Negative subnet matches should be specified last to filter out IPs picked by positive matches.
If not specified, node IP is picked based on cluster podCIDRs: IPv4/IPv6 address or both.

enabled.title: enabled
enabled.description: Enable Talos API access from Kubernetes pods.

allowedRoles.title: allowedRoles
allowedRoles.description:
The list of Talos API roles which can be granted for access from Kubernetes pods.

Empty list means that no roles can be granted, so access is blocked.

allowedKubernetesNamespaces.title: allowedKubernetesNamespaces
allowedKubernetesNamespaces.description: The list of Kubernetes namespaces Talos API access is available from.

endpoint.title: endpoint
endpoint.description: Where to send logs. Supported protocols are "tcp" and "udp".

type.title: type
type.description:
Defines the role of the machine within the cluster.

**Control Plane**

Control Plane node type designates the node as a control plane member.
This means it will host etcd along with the Kubernetes controlplane components such as API Server, Controller Manager, Scheduler.

**Worker**

Worker node type designates the node as a worker node.
This means it will be an available compute node for scheduling workloads.

This node type was previously known as "join"; that value is still supported but deprecated.

token.title: token
token.description:
The `token` is used by a machine to join the PKI of the cluster.
Using this token, a machine will create a certificate signing request (CSR), and request a certificate that will be used as its' identity.

ca.title: ca
ca.description:
The root certificate authority of the PKI.
It is composed of a base64 encoded `crt` and `key`.

certSANs.title: certSANs
certSANs.description:
Extra certificate subject alternative names for the machine's certificate.
By default, all non-loopback interface IPs are automatically added to the certificate's SANs.

controlPlane.title: controlPlane
controlPlane.description: Provides machine specific control plane configuration options.

kubelet.title: kubelet
kubelet.description: Used to provide additional options to the kubelet.

pods.title: pods
pods.description:
Used to provide static pod definitions to be run by the kubelet directly bypassing the kube-apiserver.

Static pods can be used to run components which should be started before the Kubernetes control plane is up.
Talos doesn't validate the pod definition.
Updates to this field can be applied without a reboot.

See https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/static-pod/.

network.title: network
network.description: Provides machine specific network configuration options.

disks.title: disks
disks.description:
Used to partition, format and mount additional disks.
Since the rootfs is read only with the exception of `/var`, mounts are only valid if they are under `/var`.
Note that the partitioning and formatting is done only once, if and only if no existing XFS partitions are found.
If `size:` is omitted, the partition is sized to occupy the full disk.

install.title: install
install.description: Used to provide instructions for installations.

files.title: files
files.description:
Allows the addition of user specified files.
The value of `op` can be `create`, `overwrite`, or `append`.
In the case of `create`, `path` must not exist.
In the case of `overwrite`, and `append`, `path` must be a valid file.
If an `op` value of `append` is used, the existing file will be appended.
Note that the file contents are not required to be base64 encoded.

env.title: env
env.description:
The `env` field allows for the addition of environment variables.
All environment variables are set on PID 1 in addition to every service.

time.title: time
time.description: Used to configure the machine's time settings.

sysctls.title: sysctls
sysctls.description: Used to configure the machine's sysctls.

sysfs.title: sysfs
sysfs.description: Used to configure the machine's sysfs.

registries.title: registries
registries.description:
Used to configure the machine's container image registry mirrors.

Automatically generates matching CRI configuration for registry mirrors.

The `mirrors` section allows to redirect requests for images to non-default registry,
which might be local registry or caching mirror.

The `config` section provides a way to authenticate to the registry with TLS client
identity, provide registry CA, or authentication information.
Authentication information has same meaning with the corresponding field in `.docker/config.json`.

See also matching configuration for [CRI containerd plugin](https://github.com/containerd/cri/blob/master/docs/registry.md).

systemDiskEncryption.title: systemDiskEncryption
systemDiskEncryption.description:
Machine system disk encryption configuration.
Defines each system partition encryption parameters.

features.title: features
features.description: Features describe individual Talos features that can be switched on or off.

seccompProfiles.title: seccompProfiles
seccompProfiles.description: Configures the seccomp profiles for the machine.

nodeLabels.title: nodeLabels
nodeLabels.description: Configures the node labels for the machine.

controllerManager.title: controllerManager
controllerManager.description: Controller manager machine specific configuration options.

device.title: device
device.description: The name of the disk to use.

partitions.title: partitions
partitions.description: A list of partitions to create on the disk.

name.title: name
name.description: The `name` field is used to provide the file name of the seccomp profile.

value.title: value
value.description: The `value` field is used to provide the seccomp profile.

hostname.title: hostname
hostname.description: Used to statically set the hostname for the machine.

interfaces.title: interfaces
interfaces.description:
`interfaces` is used to define the network interface configuration.
By default all network interfaces will attempt a DHCP discovery.
This can be further tuned through this configuration parameter.

nameservers.title: nameservers
nameservers.description:
Used to statically set the nameservers for the machine.
Defaults to `1.1.1.1` and `8.8.8.8`

extraHostEntries.title: extraHostEntries
extraHostEntries.description: Allows for extra entries to be added to the `/etc/hosts` file

disableSearchDomain.title: disableSearchDomain
disableSearchDomain.description:
Disable generating a default search domain in /etc/resolv.conf
based on the machine hostname.
Defaults to `false`.

busPath.title: busPath
busPath.description: PCI, USB bus prefix, supports matching by wildcard.

hardwareAddr.title: hardwareAddr
hardwareAddr.description: Device hardware address, supports matching by wildcard.

pciID.title: pciID
pciID.description: PCI ID (vendor ID, product ID), supports matching by wildcard.

driver.title: driver
driver.description: Kernel driver, supports matching by wildcard.

enabled.title: enabled
enabled.description:
Enable the KubeSpan feature.
Cluster discovery should be enabled with .cluster.discovery.enabled for KubeSpan to be enabled.

advertiseKubernetesNetworks.title: advertiseKubernetesNetworks
advertiseKubernetesNetworks.description:
Control whether Kubernetes pod CIDRs are announced over KubeSpan from the node.
If disabled, CNI handles encapsulating pod-to-pod traffic into some node-to-node tunnel,
and KubeSpan handles the node-to-node traffic.
If enabled, KubeSpan will take over pod-to-pod traffic and send it over KubeSpan directly.
When enabled, KubeSpan should have a way to detect complete pod CIDRs of the node which
is not always the case with CNIs not relying on Kubernetes for IPAM.

allowDownPeerBypass.title: allowDownPeerBypass
allowDownPeerBypass.description:
Skip sending traffic via KubeSpan if the peer connection state is not up.
This provides configurable choice between connectivity and security: either traffic is always
forced to go via KubeSpan (even if Wireguard peer connection is not up), or traffic can go directly
to the peer if Wireguard connection can't be established.

mtu.title: mtu
mtu.description:
KubeSpan link MTU size.
Default value is 1420.

filters.title: filters
filters.description:
KubeSpan advanced filtering of network addresses .

Settings in this section are optional, and settings apply only to the node.

image.title: image
image.description: The `image` field is an override to the default pod-checkpointer image.

disabled.title: disabled
disabled.description: Disable kube-proxy deployment on cluster bootstrap.

image.title: image
image.description: The container image used in the kube-proxy manifest.

mode.title: mode
mode.description:
proxy mode of kube-proxy.
The default is 'iptables'.

extraArgs.title: extraArgs
extraArgs.description: Extra arguments to supply to kube-proxy.

mirrors.title: mirrors
mirrors.description:
Specifies mirror configuration for each registry.
This setting allows to use local pull-through caching registires,
air-gapped installations, etc.

Registry name is the first segment of image identifier, with 'docker.io'
being default one.

config.title: config
config.description:
Specifies TLS & auth configuration for HTTPS image registries.
Mutual TLS can be enabled with 'clientIdentity' option.

TLS configuration can be skipped if registry has trusted
server certificate.

username.title: username
username.description:
Optional registry authentication.
The meaning of each field is the same with the corresponding field in .docker/config.json.

password.title: password
password.description:
Optional registry authentication.
The meaning of each field is the same with the corresponding field in .docker/config.json.

auth.title: auth
auth.description:
Optional registry authentication.
The meaning of each field is the same with the corresponding field in .docker/config.json.

identityToken.title: identityToken
identityToken.description:
Optional registry authentication.
The meaning of each field is the same with the corresponding field in .docker/config.json.

tls.title: tls
tls.description: The TLS configuration for the registry.

auth.title: auth
auth.description:
The auth configuration for this registry.
Note: changes to the registry auth will not be picked up by the CRI containerd plugin without a reboot.

endpoints.title: endpoints
endpoints.description:
List of endpoints (URLs) for registry mirrors to use.
Endpoint configures HTTP/HTTPS access mode, host name,
port and path (if path is not set, it defaults to `/v2`).

overridePath.title: overridePath
overridePath.description:
Use the exact path specified for the endpoint (don't append /v2/).
This setting is often required for setting up multiple mirrors
on a single instance of a registry.

clientIdentity.title: clientIdentity
clientIdentity.description:
Enable mutual TLS authentication with the registry.
Client certificate and key should be base64-encoded.

ca.title: ca
ca.description:
CA registry certificate to add the list of trusted certificates.
Certificate should be base64-encoded.

insecureSkipVerify.title: insecureSkipVerify
insecureSkipVerify.description: Skip TLS server certificate verification (not recommended).

gateway.title: gateway
gateway.description: The route's gateway (if empty, creates link scope route).

metric.title: metric
metric.description: The optional metric for the route.

mtu.title: mtu
mtu.description: The optional MTU for the route.

enabled.title: enabled
enabled.description: Whether Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) is enabled.

image.title: image
image.description: The container image used in the scheduler manifest.

extraArgs.title: extraArgs
extraArgs.description: Extra arguments to supply to the scheduler.

extraVolumes.title: extraVolumes
extraVolumes.description: Extra volumes to mount to the scheduler static pod.

env.title: env
env.description: The `env` field allows for the addition of environment variables for the control plane component.

disabled.title: disabled
disabled.description:
Indicates if the time service is disabled for the machine.
Defaults to `false`.

servers.title: servers
servers.description:
Specifies time (NTP) servers to use for setting the system time.
Defaults to `pool.ntp.org`

bootTimeout.title: bootTimeout
bootTimeout.description:
Specifies the timeout when the node time is considered to be in sync unlocking the boot sequence.
NTP sync will be still running in the background.
Defaults to "infinity" (waiting forever for time sync)

rules.title: rules
rules.description: List of udev rules to apply to the udev system

apiToken.title: apiToken
apiToken.description: Specifies the Equinix Metal API Token.

apiToken.title: apiToken
apiToken.description: Specifies the Hetzner Cloud API Token.

addresses.title: addresses
addresses.description: The addresses in CIDR notation or as plain IPs to use.

routes.title: routes
routes.description: A list of routes associated with the VLAN.

dhcp.title: dhcp
dhcp.description: Indicates if DHCP should be used.

vip.title: vip
vip.description: The VLAN's virtual IP address configuration.

dhcpOptions.title: dhcpOptions
dhcpOptions.description:
DHCP specific options.
`dhcp` *must* be set to true for these to take effect.
